listData.name: First Home Buyer Loan - Owner Occupied - SO
listData.description: Our first home buyer loan makes it easy to achieve your first home ownership dreams.

features.additionalInfo: A Mortgage Offset Account can be linked to a First Home Buyer Loan. The money you put in your linked Mortgage Offset Account reduces the balance on which the interest is charged on your home loan.

Your loan comes with a repayment redraw facility. This gives you access to additional repayments if you   re at least one full repayment ahead, you can redraw $100 or more. It   s simple to redraw using our App or Online Banking.
Get faster payments between participating banks, anytime with Pay ID
40 years
You can increase your loan amount throughout the life of the loan, subject to equity held in your property and our approval.
Switching is a change to one or more aspects of your loan's terms and conditions, for example switching from a variable rate to a fixed rate.
Splitting is when you divide one loan into two or more loan accounts, generally with different loan types, repayment types or interest rates.

Lenders Mortgage Insurance will be required if you borrow over 80% of the value of your home (or borrow an additional amount on your existing mortgage that brings the overall loan amount over 80% LVR). LMI is a one-off cost added to the total loan amount and is not a bank fee or an establishment fee.
Flexible repayment options weekly, fortnightly or monthly
You can make extra repayments or repay your loan in full at any time. Extra repayments may enable you to redraw funds, subject to conditions

A guarantor supports the loan by providing us with an additional security such as their home. By providing a guarantee, we may lend to the borrower in situations where they may not have been able to secure the full amount of the loan they require.
This loan can be used for the purposes of owner occupied property or vacant land (non-commercial), off the plan purchases and building/construction purposes.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Individuals must have the legal capacity to enter into the loan contract, provide acceptable identification documentation and be 18 years or older
You must be an Australian citizen or permanent resident to apply
Applications for credit are subject to the Bank   s eligibility and suitability criteria and normal credit approval process.

fees.name: LOAN_SWITCH_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged to switch your loan account from one type to another

fees.name: VALUATION_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged to cover the cost of obtaining a valuation report on your property or the property being purchased

fees.name: MORTGAGE_PREPARATION_FEES
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged for legal services including preparation of legal documents and attending settlement

fees.name: TITLE_SEARCH_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A third party cost for a Title Search to determine any interests in a property

fees.name: REGISTRATION_FEES
fees.additionalInfo: A third party cost for registration of mortgage

fees.name: STAMP_DUTY_(MORTGAGE)
fees.additionalInfo: The tax charged on written documents and certain transactions imposed by the state government, such as mortgages and property transfers

fees.name: PEXA_SERVICE_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged to cover third party costs associated with the establishment of your mortgage

fees.name: LENDERS_MORTGAGE_INSURANCE
fees.additionalInfo: Third party cost for insurance that protects the lender in the event that the borrower defaults on their home or investment loan

fees.name: MORTGAGE_ADMINISTRATION_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged if we are asked by you or your legal representative to make any of our loan documents available to you during the life of the loan

fees.name: CONSENT_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged for consent to a subsequent mortgage in favour of an another lender where we hold the prior mortgage

fees.name: MORTGAGE_DISCHARGE_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged if you repay your loan and request us to discharge your mortgage, includes our costs and is in addition to any costs incurred by us from external parties

fees.name: MORTGAGE_DISCHARGE_-_REGISTRATION_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged to cover third party costs associated with the discharge of your mortgage

fees.name: MORTGAGE_DISCHARGE_-_PEXA_SERVICE_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged to cover third party costs associated with the discharge of your mortgage

fees.name: VARIATION_OF_SECURITY
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged for the variation of security or other loan details, requiring us to issue new documents or re-assess your loan in any way

fees.name: MORTGAGE_REDRAW_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged to access the redraw facility on your home loan

fees.name: LATE_PAYMENT_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged when you don't make your minimum monthly payment, plus any overdue amount

fees.name: DEFAULT_NOTICE_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged if you default on your repayments and we issue a default notice

lendingRates.additionalInfo: Comparison rate based on $150,000 loan over 25 years. WARNING: This comparison rate is true only for the examples given and may not include all fees and charges. Different terms, fees or other loan amounts might result in a different comparison rate.

features.additionalInfo: Our Visa Debit Card offers quick, secure and convenient access to your money in person, online, overseas and over the phone. Enjoy the convenience of paying directly from your account, with all of the security you would expect from Visa.

Backed by the Government Deposit Guarantee for deposits up to $250,000

listData.name: Fixed Rate Home Loan - Owner Occupier - P&I - 36 mths
listData.description: The security of a fixed rate, providing you with the certainty of knowing your repayments won't change during the fixed rate period.

features.additionalInfo: Offset is not Available

Your loan comes with a repayment redraw facility. This gives you access to additional repayments if you   re at least one full repayment ahead, you can redraw $100 or more. It   s simple to redraw using our App or Online Banking.
Get faster payments between participating banks, anytime with Pay ID
30 years

If the fixed interest rate changes between the disclosure date on your loan contract and the loan funding date, the applicable fixed interest rate on your loan will be the rate at the date of your loan funding - which could be a higher (or lower) rate. If you request we can rate lock your fixed interest rates prior to the loan being funded, for a non-refundable fee.
Extra repayments of up to 5% of the loan balance per annum
Flexible repayment options weekly, fortnightly or monthly

Switching is a change to one or more aspects of your loan's terms and conditions, for example switching from a variable rate to a fixed rate or switching from Interest Only to Principal and Interest repayments.
Splitting is when you divide one loan into two or more loan accounts, generally with different loan types, repayment types or interest rates.

You can borrow additional funds subject to equity held in your property and our approval. However it's important to know that a top up would break your fixed rate contract and therefore a Break Fee Cost may apply. Please contact us to discuss this.

Lenders Mortgage Insurance will be required if you borrow over 80% of the value of your home (or borrow an additional amount on your existing mortgage that brings the overall loan amount over 80% LVR). LMI is a one-off cost added to the total loan amount and is not a bank fee or an establishment fee.

A guarantor supports the loan by providing us with an additional security such as their home. By providing a guarantee, we may lend to the borrower in situations where they may not have been able to secure the full amount of the loan they require.

This loan can be used for the purposes of owner occupied property purchases, refinancing your existing home loan, purchasing of vacant land (non-commercial), personal needs, off the plan purchases and building/construction purposes.
At the end of the fixed rate period the loan will continue as a fixed rate loan for the same period, unless you choose a different fixed rate period or a variable rate product.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Individuals must have the legal capacity to enter into the loan contract, provide acceptable identification documentation and be 18 years or older
You must be an Australian citizen or permanent resident to apply
Available for Owner Occupiers only.
Applications for credit are subject to the Bank   s eligibility and suitability criteria and normal credit approval process.

fees.name: LOAN_ESTABLISHMENT_FEE_-_MORTGAGE_LOAN_(NEW)
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged to set up a new home loan

fees.name: LOAN_ESTABLISHMENT_FEE_-_MORTGAGE_LOAN_(TOP_UP)
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged to vary the value of an existing home loan

fees.name: LOAN_ESTABLISHMENT_FEE_-_SECOND_MORTGAGE_LOAN_(NEW)
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged for consent to a subsequent new mortgage

fees.name: LOAN_ESTABLISHMENT_FEE_-_SECOND_MORTGAGE_LOAN_(TOP_UP)
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged for consent to a subsequent mortgage to vary the value of an existing home loan

fees.name: FIXED_RATE_LOCK_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged to guarantee the fixed interest rate quoted to you at loan approval for up to 90 days from the date of approval

fees.name: LOAN_SWITCH_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged to switch your loan account from one type to another

fees.name: VALUATION_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged to cover the cost of obtaining a valuation report on your property or the property being purchased

fees.name: MORTGAGE_PREPARATION_FEES
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged for legal services including preparation of legal documents and attending settlement

fees.name: TITLE_SEARCH_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A third party cost for a Title Search to determine any interests in a property

fees.name: REGISTRATION_FEES
fees.additionalInfo: A third party cost for registration of mortgage

fees.name: STAMP_DUTY_(MORTGAGE)
fees.additionalInfo: The tax charged on written documents and certain transactions imposed by the state government, such as mortgages and property transfers

fees.name: PEXA_SERVICE_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged to cover third party costs associated with the establishment of your mortgage

fees.name: LENDERS_MORTGAGE_INSURANCE
fees.additionalInfo: Third party cost for insurance that protects the lender in the event that the borrower defaults on their home or investment loan

fees.name: MORTGAGE_ADMINISTRATION_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged if we are asked by you or your legal representative to make any of our loan documents available to you during the life of the loan

fees.name: CONSENT_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged for consent to a subsequent mortgage in favour of an another lender where we hold the prior mortgage

fees.name: MORTGAGE_DISCHARGE_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged if you repay your loan and request us to discharge your mortgage, includes our costs and is in addition to any costs incurred by us from external parties

fees.name: MORTGAGE_DISCHARGE_-_REGISTRATION_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged to cover third party costs associated with the discharge of your mortgage

fees.name: MORTGAGE_DISCHARGE_-_PEXA_SERVICE_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged to cover third party costs associated with the discharge of your mortgage

fees.name: VARIATION_OF_SECURITY
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged for the variation of security or other loan details, requiring us to issue new documents or re-assess your loan in any way

fees.name: MORTGAGE_REDRAW_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged to access the redraw facility on your home loan

fees.name: LATE_PAYMENT_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged when you don't make your minimum monthly payment, plus any overdue amount

fees.name: DEFAULT_NOTICE_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged if you default on your repayments and we issue a default notice

listData.name: Momentum Home Loan 60LVR - Property Investor - Variable - P&I SO
listData.description: Your lifestyle, family or financial situation may have changed since you purchased your property. Our Momentum Home Loan was designed to make refinancing from another financial institution easy.

features.additionalInfo: A Momentum Offset Account can be linked to a Momentum Home Loan. The money you put in your linked Mortgage Offset Account reduces the balance on which the interest is charged on your home loan.

Your loan comes with a repayment redraw facility. This gives you access to additional repayments if you   re at least one full repayment ahead, you can redraw $100 or more. It   s simple to redraw using our App or Online Banking.
Get faster payments between participating banks, anytime with Pay ID
30 years
You can increase your loan amount throughout the life of the loan, subject to equity held in your property and our approval.

Switching is a change to one or more aspects of your loan's terms and conditions, for example switching from a variable rate to a fixed rate or switching from Interest Only to Principal and Interest repayments.
Splitting is when you divide one loan into two or more loan accounts, generally with different loan types, repayment types or interest rates.

Lenders Mortgage Insurance will be required if you borrow over 80% of the value of your home (or borrow an additional amount on your existing mortgage that brings the overall loan amount over 80% LVR). LMI is a one-off cost added to the total loan amount and is not a bank fee or an establishment fee.
Flexible repayment options weekly, fortnightly or monthly
You can make extra repayments or repay your loan in full at any time. Extra repayments may enable you to redraw funds, subject to conditions

A guarantor supports the loan by providing us with an additional security such as their home. By providing a guarantee, we may lend to the borrower in situations where they may not have been able to secure the full amount of the loan they require.
This loan can be used for the purposes of refinancing your investment property from an another lender only, with the interest rate based on LVR tiers.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Individuals must have the legal capacity to enter into the loan contract, provide acceptable identification documentation and be 18 years or older
You must be an Australian citizen or permanent resident to apply
Applications for credit are subject to the Bank   s eligibility and suitability criteria and normal credit approval process.
Maximum LVR for this product is 60%

fees.name: LOAN_SWITCH_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged to switch your loan account from one type to another

fees.name: VALUATION_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged to cover the cost of obtaining a valuation report on your property or the property being purchased

fees.name: MORTGAGE_PREPARATION_FEES
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged for legal services including preparation of legal documents and attending settlement

fees.name: TITLE_SEARCH_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A third party cost for a Title Search to determine any interests in a property

fees.name: REGISTRATION_FEES
fees.additionalInfo: A third party cost for registration of mortgage

fees.name: STAMP_DUTY_(MORTGAGE)
fees.additionalInfo: The tax charged on written documents and certain transactions imposed by the state government, such as mortgages and property transfers

fees.name: PEXA_SERVICE_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged to cover third party costs associated with the establishment of your mortgage

fees.name: LENDERS_MORTGAGE_INSURANCE
fees.additionalInfo: Third party cost for insurance that protects the lender in the event that the borrower defaults on their home or investment loan

fees.name: MORTGAGE_ADMINISTRATION_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged if we are asked by you or your legal representative to make any of our loan documents available to you during the life of the loan

fees.name: CONSENT_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged for consent to a subsequent mortgage in favour of an another lender where we hold the prior mortgage

fees.name: MORTGAGE_DISCHARGE_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged if you repay your loan and request us to discharge your mortgage, includes our costs and is in addition to any costs incurred by us from external parties

fees.name: MORTGAGE_DISCHARGE_-_REGISTRATION_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged to cover third party costs associated with the discharge of your mortgage

fees.name: MORTGAGE_DISCHARGE_-_PEXA_SERVICE_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged to cover third party costs associated with the discharge of your mortgage

fees.name: VARIATION_OF_SECURITY
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged for the variation of security or other loan details, requiring us to issue new documents or re-assess your loan in any way

fees.name: MORTGAGE_REDRAW_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged to access the redraw facility on your home loan

fees.name: LATE_PAYMENT_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged when you don't make your minimum monthly payment, plus any overdue amount

fees.name: DEFAULT_NOTICE_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged if you default on your repayments and we issue a default notice

lendingRates.additionalInfo: Comparison rate based on $150,000 loan over 25 years. WARNING: This comparison rate is true only for the examples given and may not include all fees and charges. Different terms, fees or other loan amounts might result in a different comparison rate.

listData.name: Term Deposit
listData.description: With a Term Deposit your money is invested for a fixed period of time with a guaranteed rate of return. Term deposit rates vary depending on the amount you invest and the length of time.

features.additionalInfo: We'll send you a term deposit renewal notice 2 weeks before it matures, not only as a reminder but to also explain what you can do next.
Backed by the Government Deposit Guarantee for deposits up to $250,000

Automatically rollover your existing Term Deposit at the rate of interest relevant to the new term that you select, or we will re-invest the principal and interest in accordance with the account instructions we received from you when the Term Deposit was established.
Early withdrawal will be allowed at the discretion of the Bank on 31 days notice. Reduced interest rates may apply.

depositRates.additionalInfo: All deposits made to the account receive interest on the balance together with a bonus interest, if these conditions are met: no withdrawals or transfers are made in the month, account not closed during the month and minimum $100 deposit each month by cash, cheque, payroll credit or direct credit.

listData.name: Choice Home Loan - Owner Occupied - Variable - P&I - With Offset
listData.description: A home loan with the choice of an optional offset account attached to reduce the amount of interest charged.

features.additionalInfo: Your loan comes with a repayment redraw facility. This gives you access to additional repayments if you   re at least one full repayment ahead, you can redraw $100 or more. It   s simple to redraw using our App or Online Banking.
Get faster payments between participating banks, anytime with Pay ID
30 years
You can increase your loan amount throughout the life of the loan, subject to equity held in your property and our approval.

Switching is a change to one or more aspects of your loan's terms and conditions, for example switching from a variable rate to a fixed rate or switching from Interest Only to Principal and Interest repayments.
Splitting is when you divide one loan into two or more loan accounts, generally with different loan types, repayment types or interest rates.

Lenders Mortgage Insurance will be required if you borrow over 80% of the value of your home (or borrow an additional amount on your existing mortgage that brings the overall loan amount over 80% LVR). LMI is a one-off cost added to the total loan amount and is not a bank fee or an establishment fee.
Flexible repayment options weekly, fortnightly or monthly
You can make extra repayments or repay your loan in full at any time. Extra repayments may enable you to redraw funds, subject to conditions

A guarantor supports the loan by providing us with an additional security such as their home. By providing a guarantee, we may lend to the borrower in situations where they may not have been able to secure the full amount of the loan they require.

This loan can be used for the purposes of owner occupied property purchases, refinancing your existing home loan, purchasing of vacant land (non-commercial), personal needs, off the plan purchases and building/construction purposes.

A Choice Mortgage Offset Account can be linked to a Choice Home Loan. The money you put in your linked Choice Mortgage Offset Account reduces the balance on which the interest is charged on your home loan.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Individuals must have the legal capacity to enter into the loan contract, provide acceptable identification documentation and be 18 years or older
You must be an Australian citizen or permanent resident to apply
Applications for credit are subject to the Bank   s eligibility and suitability criteria and normal credit approval process.

fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged to set up a new home loan

fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged to vary the value of an existing home loan

fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged for consent to a subsequent new mortgage

fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged for consent to a subsequent mortgage to vary the value of an existing home loan

fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged for legal services including preparation of legal documents and attending settlement

fees.additionalInfo: A third party cost for a Title Search to determine any interests in a property

fees.name: REGISTRATION_FEES
fees.additionalInfo: A third party cost for registration of mortgage

fees.name: STAMP_DUTY_(MORTGAGE)
fees.additionalInfo: The tax charged on written documents and certain transactions imposed by the state government, such as mortgages and property transfers

fees.name: PEXA_SERVICE_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged to cover third party costs associated with the establishment of your mortgage

fees.name: LENDERS_MORTGAGE_INSURANCE
fees.additionalInfo: Third party cost for insurance that protects the lender in the event that the borrower defaults on their home or investment loan

fees.name: MORTGAGE_ADMINISTRATION_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged if we are asked by you or your legal representative to make any of our loan documents available to you during the life of the loan

fees.name: CONSENT_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged for consent to a subsequent mortgage in favour of an another lender where we hold the prior mortgage

fees.name: MORTGAGE_DISCHARGE_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged if you repay your loan and request us to discharge your mortgage, includes our costs and is in addition to any costs incurred by us from external parties

fees.name: MORTGAGE_DISCHARGE_-_REGISTRATION_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged to cover third party costs associated with the discharge of your mortgage

fees.name: MORTGAGE_DISCHARGE_-_PEXA_SERVICE_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged to cover third party costs associated with the discharge of your mortgage

fees.name: VARIATION_OF_SECURITY
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged for the variation of security or other loan details, requiring us to issue new documents or re-assess your loan in any way

fees.name: MORTGAGE_REDRAW_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged to access the redraw facility on your home loan

fees.name: LATE_PAYMENT_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged when you don't make your minimum monthly payment, plus any overdue amount

fees.name: DEFAULT_NOTICE_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged if you default on your repayments and we issue a default notice

features.additionalInfo: Your loan comes with a repayment redraw facility. This gives you access to additional repayments if you   re at least one full repayment ahead, you can redraw $100 or more. It   s simple to redraw using our App or Online Banking.
Get faster payments between participating banks, anytime with Pay ID
30 years
You can increase your loan amount throughout the life of the loan, subject to equity held in your property and our approval.

Switching is a change to one or more aspects of your loan's terms and conditions, for example switching from a variable rate to a fixed rate or switching from Interest Only to Principal and Interest repayments.
Splitting is when you divide one loan into two or more loan accounts, generally with different loan types, repayment types or interest rates.

Lenders Mortgage Insurance will be required if you borrow over 80% of the value of your home (or borrow an additional amount on your existing mortgage that brings the overall loan amount over 80% LVR). LMI is a one-off cost added to the total loan amount and is not a bank fee or an establishment fee.
Flexible repayment options weekly, fortnightly or monthly
You can make extra repayments or repay your loan in full at any time. Extra repayments may enable you to redraw funds, subject to conditions

A guarantor supports the loan by providing us with an additional security such as their home. By providing a guarantee, we may lend to the borrower in situations where they may not have been able to secure the full amount of the loan they require.

This loan can be used for the purposes of owner occupied property purchases, refinancing your existing home loan, purchasing of vacant land (non-commercial), personal needs, off the plan purchases and building/construction purposes.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Individuals must have the legal capacity to enter into the loan contract, provide acceptable identification documentation and be 18 years or older
You must be an Australian citizen or permanent resident to apply

detailData.name: Momentum Home Loan 60-80LVR - Property Investor - Variable - Interest Only SO
detailData.description: Your lifestyle, family or financial situation may have changed since you purchased your property. Our Momentum Home Loan was designed to make refinancing from another financial institution easy.

listData.name: Retirees Access Home Loan
listData.description: The Retirees Access Home Loan is a reverse mortgage for retirees to borrow against the equity in their home. Balance of the loan is paid by your estate or when the property is vacated or sold.

features.additionalInfo: Your loan comes with a repayment redraw facility. This gives you access to additional repayments if you   re at least one full repayment ahead, you can redraw $100 or more. It   s simple to redraw using our App or Online Banking.
Get faster payments between participating banks, anytime with Pay ID
No term. Payable on death of member or on vacating or sale of the property.

Regular repayments not required. Lump sum repayments can be made at any time. Provided you are not in default, the loan will be repaid when the mortgaged property is sold on your death or death of the last borrower; the mortgaged property ceases to be your principal place of residence or that of the last surviving borrower; or on the death of the last surviving approved resident, where applicable.
You or your estate cannot end up owing more than the value of the mortgaged property provided the terms and conditions of this loan have been met.

The amount you borrow from your Retirees Access Home Loan and compound interest charged to the loan, will affect the amount you receive from the sale of the property (known as the equity in your property) should you ever need to sell it. Your equity in the property is likely to vary over time as both the market value of the property varies and the balance of the loan account increases.
If you are living with someone who is not a borrower and the loan becomes repayable because you die or cease to permanently reside in the property, they will have to move out and live somewhere else.

Any suitable purpose which includes personal use of cash for everyday living or things such as home renovations, an overseas holiday or a new car. The reverse mortgage can also be used to refinance an existing mortgage. A reverse mortgage cannot be used for business purposes or against a property in a retirement village.

constraints.additionalInfo: Maximum borrowing amount determined by age of the youngest borrower and loan to value ratio. Based on the assessed property value, borrowers may be eligible for the following amounts: Age 60 to 64 - $200,000 (or up to 15% of property value); 65 to 69 - $250,000 (or 20%); 70 to 74 - $300,000 (or 25%); 75 to 79 - $350,000 (or 35%); 80+ - $400,000 (or 40%) - whichever amount is lower in all cases.

eligibility.additionalInfo: The sole applicant and in case of a joint application, the youngest borrower, must be 60 years of age or older. In the case of multiple applicants, all applicants must be 60 years of age or older and hold title to the property either as joint tenants or tenants in common.
You must be an Australian citizen or permanent resident to apply
At least one of the applicants or an approved resident must reside in the property (except where the property is an investment property or holiday home).
Eligibility also depends on the property   s value (which G&C will determine) and its location.
Applications for credit are subject to the Bank   s eligibility and suitability criteria and normal credit approval process.

fees.name: TITLE_SEARCH_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A third party cost for a Title Search to determine any interests in a property

fees.name: REGISTRATION_FEES
fees.additionalInfo: A third party cost for registration of mortgage

fees.name: STAMP_DUTY_(MORTGAGE)
fees.additionalInfo: The tax charged on written documents and certain transactions imposed by the state government, such as mortgages and property transfers

fees.name: PEXA_SERVICE_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged to cover third party costs associated with the establishment of your mortgage

fees.name: LENDERS_MORTGAGE_INSURANCE
fees.additionalInfo: Third party cost for insurance that protects the lender in the event that the borrower defaults on their home or investment loan

fees.name: MORTGAGE_ADMINISTRATION_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged if we are asked by you or your legal representative to make any of our loan documents available to you during the life of the loan

fees.name: CONSENT_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged for consent to a subsequent mortgage in favour of an another lender where we hold the prior mortgage

fees.name: MORTGAGE_DISCHARGE_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged if you repay your loan and request us to discharge your mortgage, includes our costs and is in addition to any costs incurred by us from external parties

fees.name: MORTGAGE_DISCHARGE_-_REGISTRATION_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged to cover third party costs associated with the discharge of your mortgage

fees.name: MORTGAGE_DISCHARGE_-_PEXA_SERVICE_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged to cover third party costs associated with the discharge of your mortgage

fees.name: VARIATION_OF_SECURITY
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged for the variation of security or other loan details, requiring us to issue new documents or re-assess your loan in any way

fees.name: MORTGAGE_REDRAW_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged to access the redraw facility on your home loan

fees.name: LATE_PAYMENT_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged when you don't make your minimum monthly payment, plus any overdue amount

fees.name: DEFAULT_NOTICE_FEE
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged if you default on your repayments and we issue a default notice

detailData.name: Fixed Rate Home Loan - Property Investor - P&I - 24 mths
detailData.description: The security of a fixed rate, providing you with the certainty of knowing your repayments won't change during the fixed rate period.

listData.name: Fixed Rate Home Loan - Property Investor - P&I - 36 mths
listData.description: The security of a fixed rate, providing you with the certainty of knowing your repayments won't change during the fixed rate period.

features.additionalInfo: Offset is not Available

Your loan comes with a repayment redraw facility. This gives you access to additional repayments if you   re at least one full repayment ahead, you can redraw $100 or more. It   s simple to redraw using our App or Online Banking.
Get faster payments between participating banks, anytime with Pay ID
30 years

If the fixed interest rate changes between the disclosure date on your loan contract and the loan funding date, the applicable fixed interest rate on your loan will be the rate at the date of your loan funding - which could be a higher (or lower) rate. If you request we can rate lock your fixed interest rates prior to the loan being funded, for a non-refundable fee.
Extra repayments of up to 5% of the loan balance per annum
Flexible repayment options weekly, fortnightly or monthly

Switching is a change to one or more aspects of your loan's terms and conditions, for example switching from a variable rate to a fixed rate or switching from Interest Only to Principal and Interest repayments.
Splitting is when you divide one loan into two or more loan accounts, generally with different loan types, repayment types or interest rates.

You can borrow additional funds subject to equity held in your property and our approval. However it's important to know that a top up would break your fixed rate contract and therefore a Break Fee Cost may apply. Please contact us to discuss this.

Lenders Mortgage Insurance will be required if you borrow over 80% of the value of your home (or borrow an additional amount on your existing mortgage that brings the overall loan amount over 80% LVR). LMI is a one-off cost added to the total loan amount and is not a bank fee or an establishment fee.

A guarantor supports the loan by providing us with an additional security such as their home. By providing a guarantee, we may lend to the borrower in situations where they may not have been able to secure the full amount of the loan they require.

This loan can be used for investment property purchases, refinancing your existing home loan, purchasing of vacant land (non-commercial), personal needs, personal investments, off the plan purchases, bridging loan and building/construction purposes.
At the end of the fixed rate period the loan will continue as a fixed rate loan for the same period, unless you choose a different fixed rate period or a variable rate product.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Individuals must have the legal capacity to enter into the loan contract, provide acceptable identification documentation and be 18 years or older
You must be an Australian citizen or permanent resident to apply
Available for Property Investors only.
Applications for credit are subject to the Bank   s eligibility and suitability criteria and normal credit approval process.

Splitting is when you divide one loan into two or more loan accounts, generally with different loan types, repayment types or interest rates.

You can borrow additional funds subject to equity held in your property and our approval. However it's important to know that a top up would break your fixed rate contract and therefore a Break Fee Cost may apply. Please contact us to discuss this.

Lenders Mortgage Insurance will be required if you borrow over 80% of the value of your home (or borrow an additional amount on your existing mortgage that brings the overall loan amount over 80% LVR). LMI is a one-off cost added to the total loan amount and is not a bank fee or an establishment fee.

A guarantor supports the loan by providing us with an additional security such as their home. By providing a guarantee, we may lend to the borrower in situations where they may not have been able to secure the full amount of the loan they require.

This loan can be used for the purposes of owner occupied property purchases, refinancing your existing home loan, purchasing of vacant land (non-commercial), personal needs, off the plan purchases and building/construction purposes.
At the end of the fixed rate period the loan will continue as a fixed rate loan for the same period, unless you choose a different fixed rate period or a variable rate product.

listData.description: The security of a fixed rate, providing you with the certainty of knowing your repayments won't change during the fixed rate period.

features.additionalInfo: Offset is not Available
Redraw is not available during a fixed rate period
Get faster payments between participating banks, anytime with Pay ID
30 years

If the fixed interest rate changes between the disclosure date on your loan contract and the loan funding date, the applicable fixed interest rate on your loan will be the rate at the date of your loan funding - which could be a higher (or lower) rate. If you request we can rate lock your fixed interest rates prior to the loan being funded, for a non-refundable fee.
Extra repayments of up to 5% of the loan balance per annum
Interest Only - monthly due 1st day of each month

Switching is a change to one or more aspects of your loan's terms and conditions, for example switching from a variable rate to a fixed rate or switching from Interest Only to Principal and Interest repayments.
Splitting is when you divide one loan into two or more loan accounts, generally with different loan types, repayment types or interest rates.

You can borrow additional funds subject to equity held in your property and our approval. However it's important to know that a top up would break your fixed rate contract and therefore a Break Fee Cost may apply. Please contact us to discuss this.

Lenders Mortgage Insurance will be required if you borrow over 80% of the value of your home (or borrow an additional amount on your existing mortgage that brings the overall loan amount over 80% LVR). LMI is a one-off cost added to the total loan amount and is not a bank fee or an establishment fee.

A guarantor supports the loan by providing us with an additional security such as their home. By providing a guarantee, we may lend to the borrower in situations where they may not have been able to secure the full amount of the loan they require.

This loan can be used for investment property purchases, refinancing your existing home loan, purchasing of vacant land (non-commercial), personal needs, personal investments, off the plan purchases, bridging loan and building/construction purposes.
At the end of the fixed rate period the loan will continue as a fixed rate loan for the same period, unless you choose a different fixed rate period or a variable rate product.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Individuals must have the legal capacity to enter into the loan contract, provide acceptable identification documentation and be 18 years or older
You must be an Australian citizen or permanent resident to apply
Available for Property Investors only.
Applications for credit are subject to the Bank   s eligibility and suitability criteria and normal credit approval process.

fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged for the variation of security or other loan details, requiring us to issue new documents or re-assess your loan in any way

fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged to access the redraw facility on your home loan

detailData.name: Fixed Rate Home Loan - Owner Occupier - I/O - 24 mths
detailData.description: The security of a fixed rate, providing you with the certainty of knowing your repayments won't change during the fixed rate period.

listData.name: Fixed Rate Home Loan - Owner Occupier - I/O - 36 mths
listData.description: The security of a fixed rate, providing you with the certainty of knowing your repayments won't change during the fixed rate period.

features.additionalInfo: Offset is not Available
Redraw is not available during a fixed rate period
Get faster payments between participating banks, anytime with Pay ID
30 years

If the fixed interest rate changes between the disclosure date on your loan contract and the loan funding date, the applicable fixed interest rate on your loan will be the rate at the date of your loan funding - which could be a higher (or lower) rate. If you request we can rate lock your fixed interest rates prior to the loan being funded, for a non-refundable fee.
Extra repayments of up to 5% of the loan balance per annum
Interest Only - monthly due 1st day of each month

Switching is a change to one or more aspects of your loan's terms and conditions, for example switching from a variable rate to a fixed rate or switching from Interest Only to Principal and Interest repayments.
Splitting is when you divide one loan into two or more loan accounts, generally with different loan types, repayment types or interest rates.

You can borrow additional funds subject to equity held in your property and our approval. However it's important to know that a top up would break your fixed rate contract and therefore a Break Fee Cost may apply. Please contact us to discuss this.

Lenders Mortgage Insurance will be required if you borrow over 80% of the value of your home (or borrow an additional amount on your existing mortgage that brings the overall loan amount over 80% LVR). LMI is a one-off cost added to the total loan amount and is not a bank fee or an establishment fee.

A guarantor supports the loan by providing us with an additional security such as their home. By providing a guarantee, we may lend to the borrower in situations where they may not have been able to secure the full amount of the loan they require.

This loan can be used for the purposes of owner occupied property purchases, refinancing your existing home loan, purchasing of vacant land (non-commercial), personal needs, off the plan purchases and building/construction purposes.
At the end of the fixed rate period the loan will continue as a fixed rate loan for the same period, unless you choose a different fixed rate period or a variable rate product.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Individuals must have the legal capacity to enter into the loan contract, provide acceptable identification documentation and be 18 years or older
You must be an Australian citizen or permanent resident to apply
Available for Owner Occupiers only.
Applications for credit are subject to the Bank   s eligibility and suitability criteria and normal credit approval process.

features.additionalInfo: A Mortgage Offset Account can be linked to a Standard Variable Home Loan. The money you put in your linked Mortgage Offset Account reduces the balance on which the interest is charged on your home loan.

Your loan comes with a repayment redraw facility. This gives you access to additional repayments if you   re at least one full repayment ahead, you can redraw $100 or more. It   s simple to redraw using our App or Online Banking.
Get faster payments between participating banks, anytime with Pay ID
30 years
You can increase your loan amount throughout the life of the loan, subject to equity held in your property and our approval.

Switching is a change to one or more aspects of your loan's terms and conditions, for example switching from a variable rate to a fixed rate or switching from Interest Only to Principal and Interest repayments.
Splitting is when you divide one loan into two or more loan accounts, generally with different loan types, repayment types or interest rates.

Lenders Mortgage Insurance will be required if you borrow over 80% of the value of your home (or borrow an additional amount on your existing mortgage that brings the overall loan amount over 80% LVR). LMI is a one-off cost added to the total loan amount and is not a bank fee or an establishment fee.
Interest Only - monthly due 1st day of each month
You can make extra repayments or repay your loan in full at any time. Extra repayments may enable you to redraw funds, subject to conditions

A guarantor supports the loan by providing us with an additional security such as their home. By providing a guarantee, we may lend to the borrower in situations where they may not have been able to secure the full amount of the loan they require.

This loan can be used for investment property purchases, refinancing your existing home loan, purchasing of vacant land (non-commercial), personal needs, personal investments, off the plan purchases, bridging loan and building/construction purposes.

listData.name: Sapphire Fair Rate Personal Loan Variable P&I
listData.description: Our Fair Rate Personal Loan can help to fund a range of things including holidays, buying a car and debt consolidation. The rate is guided by your credit worthiness and borrowing history.

features.additionalInfo: Easy access to your cash with our redraw facility
Get faster payments between participating banks, anytime with Pay ID
1 to 7 years
Flexible repayment options weekly, fortnightly or monthly
You can make extra repayments or repay your loan in full at any time. Extra repayments may enable you to redraw funds, subject to conditions

eligibility.additionalInfo: Individuals must have the legal capacity to enter into the loan contract, provide acceptable identification documentation and be 18 years or older
You must be an Australian citizen or permanent resident to apply
Applications for finance are subject to the Bank's normal credit approval
